---
title: "github_missing_client_secret.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines authentication settings for a system, specifically focusing on GitHub authentication. It sets up the basic structure for authentication, including session details and GitHub-specific configuration, but notably lacks the client secret for GitHub authentication.

## Symbols

### `authentication`
#### Description
The root configuration object for authentication settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Defines whether authentication is required
- Specifies session settings
- Configures authentication methods (in this case, GitHub)

### `authentication.required`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether authentication is mandatory for the system.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| required | boolean | Set to `true`, indicating that authentication is required |

### `authentication.session`
#### Description
Configures session-related settings for authentication.

#### Internal Logic
- Specifies the domain for the session
- Sets the secure flag for the session

### `authentication.session.domain`
#### Description
Defines the domain where the session is valid.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| domain | string | Set to "http://localhost:8080", indicating a local development environment |

### `authentication.session.secure`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether the session should be transmitted over a secure connection.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| secure | boolean | Set to `false`, allowing non-secure connections (typical for local development) |

### `authentication.methods`
#### Description
Defines the available authentication methods.

### `authentication.methods.github`
#### Description
Configures GitHub as an authentication method.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables GitHub authentication
- Specifies the client ID for GitHub OAuth
- Sets the redirect address after authentication
- Defines the required scopes for GitHub authentication

### `authentication.methods.github.enabled`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether GitHub authentication is enabled.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Set to `true`, enabling GitHub authentication |

### `authentication.methods.github.client_id`
#### Description
The client ID for GitHub OAuth application.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| client_id | string | Set to "client_id", a placeholder for the actual GitHub OAuth client ID |

### `authentication.methods.github.redirect_address`
#### Description
The URL where users will be redirected after GitHub authentication.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| redirect_address | string | Set to "http://localhost:8080", the local development server address |

### `authentication.methods.github.scopes`
#### Description
An array of GitHub OAuth scopes required for authentication.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| scopes | array of strings | Contains "user:email", allowing the application to access the user's email address |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| authentication.required | boolean | true | Indicates if authentication is mandatory |
| authentication.session.domain | string | "http://localhost:8080" | The domain for the authentication session |
| authentication.session.secure | boolean | false | Whether the session should be secure (set to false for local development) |
| authentication.methods.github.enabled | boolean | true | Enables GitHub authentication |
| authentication.methods.github.client_id | string | "client_id" | The client ID for GitHub OAuth |
| authentication.methods.github.redirect_address | string | "http://localhost:8080" | The redirect URL after GitHub authentication |
| authentication.methods.github.scopes | array of strings | ["user:email"] | The required GitHub OAuth scopes |

## TODOs
The configuration is missing the `client_secret` for GitHub authentication, which is a crucial component for OAuth authentication. This omission is likely intentional for the test data, but in a real-world scenario, the `client_secret` should be included and kept secure.
